title: we want to fail the call if CLI starts with +27
description: You should add new authentication rule with CLD translation rule s/.*[^0-9].*/REJ/ which will be translating CLD into symbolic for the account. If you want to block all calls that start with CLI +27 add +27* as incoming CLI.
description_text:
You should add new authentication rule with CLD translation rule s/.*[^0-9].*/REJ/ 
which will be translating CLD into symbolic for the account. If you want
 to block all calls that start with CLI +27 add +27* as incoming CLI.

title: SIP codes translation
description:
substitute 403 to 503 of server's domestic responses
insert into scode_translations_internal (i_scode_translations_internal, in_scode, out_scode, reason) values (1, 403, 503, 'Service unavailable');


and to convert codes of remote party:

INSERT INTO scode_translations_external (in_scode, out_scode, reason,i_account_class) values(403,503,'Service unavailable',2);
to get i_account_class:

select username, i_account, i_customer, i_account_class from accounts  where i_account=(select i_account from cdrs where i_call=(select i_call from calls where call_id='4e4f11ff00003a580000001372586232@ens.com'));
where call_id is the call with 403 error code.


Useful documentations:


Starting in our 5.1 Release we have added support for 3xx SIP Redirects.  For more information please see
https://support.sippysoft.com/a/solutions/articles/3000072772


Reason Header Field mapping RFC 3326, Q850 / Q.850, SIP codes translation
https://support.sippysoft.com/a/solutions/articles/3000009757


Prompts substitution of error responses

https://support.sippysoft.com/a/solutions/articles/130227

title: How to increase the voicemail record length
description:
This query increase the value to 100 sec for whole system. 


sippy=> insert into ivr_config (section, option, value, i_ivr_instance) values ('voicemail', 'maxmessagetimemsec', '100000', 1);
description_text:
This query increase the value to 100 sec for whole system.   
   
 sippy=> insert into ivr_config (section, option, value, i_ivr_instance) values ('voicemail', 'maxmessagetimemsec', '100000', 1);

title: Test Bandwidth
description:
# cd /usr/ports/benchmarks/iperf && make install && make clean

Client side: # iperf -c server_host
Server side: # iperf -s
description_text:

Server side: # iperf -s

title: How to add password policies
description: INSERT INTO password_policies (name, description, min_length, i_password_content, change_first_login, system) VALUES ('4 Digits', '90 days expiration, change on first login, 4 digits.', 4 , 3, true,true);

title: SIP Registration fails with error "AOR doesn't match accounts.username, rejecting"
description: The "Account Name" (which is the AOR or Address-Of-Record) and the VoIP Username (The Authentication Username) is probably different.
description_text: The "Account Name" (which is the AOR or Address-Of-Record) and the VoIP Username (The Authentication Username) is probably different.

title: What IP addresses does Sippy use?
description:
The list of IP addresses is available upon request from Sippy Support by opening a ticket.


As part of routine support activities, Sippy will connect to sippy switches, media relays and associated KVMs that are hosted on the clients network.


We only connect to these systems from a set of well known IP addresses. 


Clients that operate their own firewalls must also add these IP addresses to their firewall permit list in order to allow Sippy Support staff to access the Sippy systems or associated KVM systems on the clients network.
description_text:
The list of IP addresses is available upon request from Sippy Support by opening a ticket. 
   
 As part of routine support activities, Sippy will connect to sippy switches, media relays and associated KVMs that are hosted on the clients network. 
   
 We only connect to these systems from a set of well known IP addresses.  
   
 Clients that operate their own firewalls must also add these IP addresses to their firewall permit list in order to allow Sippy Support staff to access the Sippy systems or associated KVM systems on the clients network.
